content.description: The following question refers to the topic of the Second World War.
content.question: The all-out military commitment of the Soviet Union to the defeat of Germany in the Second World War is best explained in the context of

choices.label: the ideological hostility of the two regimes that made compromise or surrender unlikely
the economic interdependence of the two countries that made long-term conflict unsustainable
the growing realization among the Soviet people that communism was not a viable system
the long-term plans of Soviet leaders to spread communism throughout Europe that a German victory would make impossible

content.answer: the ideological hostility of the two regimes that made compromise or surrender unlikely
